clinical_study.brief_title: Dimiracetam in Painful Neuropathies Affecting AIDS Patients
clinical_study.official_title: Dimiracetam in Painful Neuropathies Affecting AIDS Patients. A Double-blind, Placebo-controlled, Parallel-group, Randomised, Multi-centre Study

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to assess the efficacy and tolerability of orally administered dimiracetam for 10 weeks to AIDS patients under treatment with antiretroviral agents presenting a disease and /or treatment related neuropathic pain.

primary_outcome.measure: Pain intensity measured on 100 mm VAS
primary_outcome.description: Change from baseline in pain intensity as measured on VAS

primary_outcome.measure: Pain intensity as measured with Total Symptom Score (TSS)
primary_outcome.description: Change from baseline as measured with TSS

secondary_outcome.description: Comparison of AE frequency between treatment groups
NNT needed to obtain a >60% pain relief from the initial score recorded on the VAS and TSS at study entry
comparison of CD4+ cell count vs. baseline within and between treatment groups
comparison of HIV viral load vs. screening within and between treatment groups

intervention.description: Capsules for oral administration twice daily
Inactive dose level in capsules administered orally twice daily
